Unfortunately i can't recommend it anymore. At first it was better than original Discord client on Linux but now i start getting weird issues like entire PC freezing with like a quarter of a second repeating any potential recent sounds. Made it unbearable to watch something with friends and i had to talk on phone. There also are sometimes issues where i can't open up the app.
This is amazing when it works, but after an update a couple weeks ago it no longer launches on Fedora 40. Please fix!
Vesktop makes the Discord experience so much better. I highly reccomend trying it out.
This is the best discord client available for Linux. That's all you need to know (I've been using it for a year btw).
Fails to start properly on gnome/xorg. I have encoutered 2 bugs: API rate limit. It got dismissed as a non-issue by the devs, with no suitable solution: https://github.com/Vencord/Vesktop/issues/485
summary: Doesn't work, and devs ignoring bugs

description: nope nope nope nope
Only cilent with working screenshare on wayland... shouldn't be so forceful with the LGB stuff with the icon though.
I've had troubles with the other discord app, this one is great and it works (love the icon too)

If I didn't have to use discord I wouldn't, but I do, so I use vesktop, but y'all SERIOUSLY gotta do something about that icon--and I'm not talking about the rainbow. The only thing y'all are shoving down our throats is these goddamn PIXEL SIZES in your logo, I'm on my hands and knees begging you to change that like actually
summary: Makes me hate discord a little bit less

description: Welp this solved one of my main issues I had here on Linux LOL
This is simply the best way to use discord.
I like the cute loading screen, funny fox woman. But yeah its a stable discord release that dosn't guzzle ram like the normal discord flatpak. So hopefully this one continues to be maintained.

Came across this app when trying to fix screensharing on Wayland for Discord. Not only does it allow me to share my screen, but it also gives me the option to share audio too - something that's not possible on official Discord on Linux for several years at this point.
Yet another example of passionate open source developers doing something that a profit-driven company hasn't done because they see it as "less worthy" than adding new paid profile cosmetic and whatnot.
Lovely project, well-made. Ignore the bigots crying over a rainbow.
Fantastic Discord client that finally brings functioning audio streaming to Linux!
This is the client. You found it.
Great performance, and actually supports audio in screenshares. Vencord as a mod is already fantastic, this just makes it better.
summary: The Discord app for Linux users

description: Especially with streaming: audio now works and Wayland is supported. The audio support is even better than the official app for Windows since you can share desktop audio while streaming your screen. I do not like the 'anime' themed stuff.
summary: Fixes most issues with the official app

description: Works on pretty much any computer you throw at it with a desktop. Pretty lightweight compared to BetterDiscord or stock Discord and has really decent OS support regardless if you use Windows or Alpine Linux.
Broke the day after I installed it, relevant bug on the tracker was closed and locked, with the only fix being to tank the performance. Trash
pretty good but no RPC unlike the appimage
Working screenshare with wayland immediately gives it a 5 star review. The extra vencord benefits is the cherry on top. Do wish I could change the icon though.
Better than the official discord app. Screen share works with audio.
downloaded this solely because some boomer was triggered by the icon. good app
Screenshare button doesn't work
Yep... I'm definitely staying on Linux :D Absolutely fantastic client
the client is amazing sharescreens work perfect constently updated did all stuff discord thereself havent been able to do in years.

So far this app runs wonderfully, its slightly snappier than regular discord. Screensharing works like a charm and provides higher resolution/fps options that traditional discord hides behind a pay-wall. I haven't tested speaking with anyone yet, but otherwise functionality is amazing!

The flatpak crashes a couple seconds on launch.
The developer blamed this on a hardware issue while the appimage works fine.
One can dislike the icon even if they are a member of the community the rainbow has come to represent. I just think it's poorly designed. App is great, though.

Excelent app, that has fixed a lot of problems for me on Wayland. But unfortunately I have to give only two stars simply for the fact that it obligates us to swallow that icon that represents a cause not everyone supports.

theres nothing wrong with the icon , if u have so much of a problem with a rainbow on a app icon that you can easily change, then maybe u should do some self reflection

has some slight issues with gtk themes (specifically this app) but otherwise love it

I installed Vesctop and everything just works, no issues at all.
This is the best way to run Discord on Linux by far.
I have been looking for an alternative to the default Discord app that actually has the functionality that I was looking for and I found it in Vesktop.
Best Discord experience, much more lightweigth, no discord telemetry and vencord preinstalled :thumbs:

best discord client in linux and as a flatpak package. 
with built-in screenshare flag support.
summary: i hope this project lives for ever

description: Like discord-screenaudio without the slight jank. Love it.
summary: Finally a fully functional discord app

description: what the other reviews said, make sure to check the plugins tab

Yup! I'm that grateful and excited for it! It works flawlessly and i can stream with sound AND also have my microphone too! This saves such a massive headache it's crazy!

P.S.: You may have to check in the Discord settings in ''Voice & Audio" section and re-change the ''Input Device'' to your microphone. 

These may be changed when you start a stream to ''vencord-screen-share'' but you can safely switch it over to your mic and both your voice and recorded window (specific one, not whole screen) works!
I've tried a lot this year this has so far been the best experience in terms of discord clients

One of the first things I've had that actually 'just works' and a nice introduction to vescord as well. 
Video streaming all picks up perfectly, no issues with Audio so far, all of the plugins picked up and has everything set that could be needed. Smoother than the actual version of Discord while we're at it (member of >100 servers)
unless its already the active window it reloads everything rather than just showing new content
summary: wont auto update content when not active window

description: It's a pretty good client but it just randomly stopped working and I do NOT like that

Works with wayland out of the box including screenshare which is huge for NVIDIA cards where xwayland has flickering issues on the default client. Themes and plugins are the easiest to use of any discord client I've seen.
It just work, feel snappy and scary fast, screenshare working perfectly. the only bug i found is when i click update vencord but nothing distrub daily activities.
I don't have anything bad to say, it's discord but so much better
I've spent so many hours messing with stuff trying to get the official client's screenshare to work on Linux and to no avail. This client just works out of the box.
Finally a GREAT Discord experience on Linux! No setup, just login and you're good to go. Maybe an icon change would be appreciated though.
There is no game dectection or game activity setting as your presence

I do not support the store icon of Vesktop because incompatibale with my views in life.
However, I do love everything else on this app. Great job to whoever made this. Thank you.
I again emphasize that I don't hate the people who support this vesktop icon on store so
please do not get me wrong. We can disagree but I have no rights to hate any human being
except the evil doers and wrong doers. I took 3 star off just because of that vesktop store
icon or logo.

Over all I've had an awesome experience using Vesktop, everything just works, however, since changing from X11 to Wayland on KDE Plasma I've had some strange stuttering making it unusable, its hard to describe it, and maybe is an issue only in my system, but its something to consider
To those who aren't a fan of the icon, it is possible to change it yourself. I change it to the official icon. I'm assuming that's true of all distros, but it certainly is in Ubuntu and Fedora.
Lots of customization options & improvements to Discord client for Linux users
Fantastic Discord client. Has all I need and then some. And to the Eligibility Community haters in the reviews...SEATHE

Fast, and easy to set up. No extra hoops to jump through to set up plug-ins, unlike BetterDiscord. The only downside of this app I have found is that hardware acceleration does not work properly on Wayland. Everything was glitching out for me on KDE Plasma + Wayland, but it works fine on X11. Disabling hardware acceleration fixed these graphical glitches on Wayland.
summary: Fast, and easy to set up

description: I am loving this on my deck everything works out the gate but I do wish it worked in gaming mode though. Whenever i'm in gaming mode it just refuses to open

Disgusting app for deviated minds

I would have liked to have given this app a real try, however it has one issue
There is an alignment issie with where the mouse pointer actually is relative to what part of the window is actually chosen/selected (also by right mouse-button click) within the window IF you are using screen/monitor scaling at 90% or less
Im going to make the educated guess the devs were using this app under X11
Im using KDE Plasma Wayland with a widescreen monitor at 1920 x 1080 with a scale factor of 65%
Vesktop is faster and screenshare works on wayland and intigrates vencord. I could not ask for more. Thank you for maintaning it
great app and great as you don't have to install the binary-based app for rpc as this as the ar-rpc plugin included. also to the people crying about the rainbow icon- keep crying
Would be cool if there was keybinds and working RPC
Icon is just the cherry on top
New version released but no update in the flathub version

As far as I can discern, this is the best-possible user experience I've had with Discord on Linux Fedora. I had no issues with screensharing, thanks to my clean installation; however, I did have issues with Discord continually freezing up upon minimization. This fully eliminated my issues plus further made my Discord perform better than the utilization of OpenAsar. Excellent work. I'd highly suggest this to others who(m) are looking for a quality user experience.
I love Vencord. This cilient gives me the ability to run Vencord on all of my GNU/Linux systems. I love Vesktop.
Se lagea mucho para trasmitir video
сам венкорд хорош своим разнообразием полезных плагинов, а с помощью vesktop можно наслаждаться всеми этими фишками с возможностью демонстировать экран со звуком

С первого раза после установки заработал без проблем, демка работала, аудио выходы, звук, все идеально по сравнению обычного дискорда c сильными багами. 
но после второго запуска он просто в фоне запускается и не открывается вобще, даже если его открыть через контекстное меню, перезапуская его вобще не работает. работает только после переустановки с первого запуска удаляя все сохранения. Моя ОС Fedora 39
